meanings.definition: Verb: to incite or urge on
meanings.sent1: The coach sools the players to give their best on the field.
meanings.sent2: She always sools her friends to try new things and step out of their comfort zones.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel sools the other animals into joining its nut-gathering mission.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker sools the audience to chase their dreams with passion and determination.
meanings.sent5: The teacher sools the students to explore their creativity and think outside the box.

meanings.definition: Noun: a person who incites or urges on
meanings.sent1: The sools in the group always motivates others to push themselves harder.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the sools of the team, always encouraging her teammates to do their best.
meanings.sent3: The sools of the office organized a fun team-building activity to boost morale.
meanings.sent4: He was the sools behind the successful charity event, inspiring everyone to contribute.
meanings.sent5: The sools in the family always brings positivity and enthusiasm to gatherings.

meanings.definition: Adjective: characterized by inciting or urging on
meanings.sent1: The sools leader motivated the team to achieve their goals.
meanings.sent2: Her sools personality always inspires those around her to take action.
meanings.sent3: The sools atmosphere at the concert had everyone dancing and singing along.
meanings.sent4: His sools attitude towards challenges encouraged others to face obstacles head-on.
meanings.sent5: The sools culture of the company fostered innovation and growth among employees.
